castItem.role: Tohwa - The Guardian Genius of Omai's Ancestors, and Protector of the legal Kings of Otaheite
Otoo - Father of Omai, a Descendant from the legal Kings, a Priest and a Magician

OtaheiteanThe idea of his dress was taken from Cook's Voyages, where it is said, that Omai, to make himself fine on his introduction to a Chiefs dressed himself with a piece of the habit of each country he had seen in his several voyages. - supposed to have accompanied Omai to England
Oberea - Regent and Protectress of Oediddee, an Enchantress
Don Struttolando - Rival to Omai, in his love to Londina
Clown - his Servant and Rival of Harlequin
Londina - the Consort destined to Omia

div.head: Scene 1
div.stage: A MoraiA temple, or burying place. in Otaheite by Moon-light
Otoo discovered making Invocations to the Genii of his Ancestors for their Assistance to fix his Son on the Throne.

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: Hail to this awful place! sacred Fiatoo-kaA repository for the dead hail!
Where Otaheitean Cheifs in everlasting moeSleep lie; warriors renown'd,
On Eimeo'sOne of the Society Islands, generally at war with Otaheite sanguine plains with hard=fought victory crown'd;
Tho' here in death ye moulder, yet the royal line can never fail,
Preserv'd by Towha's power divine;
And the illustrious name,
By glorious actions dear to fame,
In my belov'd Omai shall never die.

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: God of BolabolaAnother of the Society Islands, the most ferocious in war, conquerors of Ulitea, which was anciently subject to Omai's ancestors. hear!
Accept this plantain, yam, and hog, well roasted,
Offerings to they Godship dear,
With maheeBread sweet as ever boasted;
And while thus I lowly bend,
Let my humble suit ascend.
The flames arise,
Blest sacrifice!
Towha snuffs the favour;
Propitious sign
Of grace benign,
Sure token of his favor.
Say, shall my son omai reign?
Great Towha now an answer deign.

div.stage: Towha assumes the Appearance of a Chief Mourner.

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: My quiv'ring flesh, my limbs bedew'd all o'er,
Each feeble sense---my eyes---my voice---no more!

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: Spirits of peace that hover round,
Oh, chear his mortal fight!
Dispel with sweet responsive sound
The horrors of the night.
My aerial band, ar't ready?

sp.speaker: Chorus of Spirits
sp.l: Ready.

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: To run, to swim, to fly, at my command?

sp.speaker: Chorus of spirits
sp.l: Command.

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: To run?

sp.speaker: Chorus of spirits
sp.l: To run

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: To swim?

sp.speaker: Chorus of spirits
sp.l: To swim.

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: To fly?

sp.speaker: Chorus of spirits
sp.l: To fly.

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: At my command?

sp.speaker: Chorus of spirits
sp.l: Command.

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: His darling son with motion soft as MaoaianWestern breezes gales, hither convey

sp.speaker: Chorus of Spirits
sp.l: Away!

div.stage: Soft Music, and Omai brought in

sp.speaker: Chorus (Spirits)
sp.l: Happy father---Otaheite's heir!

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: Otoo's hope,

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: And Towha's care.

sp.speaker: Towha
sp.l: My precepts still from solly shall direct him,
This potent talisman from harm protect him.
sp.stage: Places the talisman by the side of Omai -- Thunder -- Britannia is seen holding Londina

sp.speaker: Britannia
sp.l: Mark, votive Islander, thy fate is mine, for mine.
The Queen of Isles, the mistress of the main!
Upon my sea-girt shore, by Neptune fenc'd,
Kind greeting, pleasure, welcome sweet receive;
Still shall my sons, by Cook's example taught,
Thy new-found world protect and humanize.
In soft alliance bound, this British maid
Be thine, and Love, a radiant throne shall fix
Firm as my rock, where sits bright Liberty.

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: The splendid vision, oh, my son obey,
Towha commands for England quick away.
But ere, lov'd youth, you quit your native shore,
Your rival Oediddee shall restore
The Royal Ensigns, Britain to convince
That in Omai she receives a Prince.

div.head: Scene 2.
div.stage: Inside of a Morai of the antient Aree-de-hy'sGrand Chiefs Ancestors of Omai.

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: Alas! to spare him you in vain implore me;
Quick, fly and bring Oediddee here before me.

sp.speaker: Oediddee
sp.l: Oh, sage Otoo! accept my true contrition,
I yield obedience to each hard condition;
Your son still loves me, still I love that son,
From childhood still the race of life we've run;
My smallest grief was anguish to his heart,
His slightest joy could every joy impart.

sp.speaker: Oediddee
sp.l: O'er groves of coral, through the deep,
Where MogeeAn excellent species of fish in those seas. fish their revel keep,
Our staunch canoes in consort glide,
Tho'stern FarooaA strong and dangerous wind swells the tide,
Small the danger each could see,
Friendship cried, you're safe with me.
On the hill, that upward towers,
Crown'd with shrubs and sweetest flowers,
There we taste eternal spring,
While the Wattle-birdThe most melodious in the Islands. shall sing
Double joys to him and me,
Ever such let friendship be.

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: Resign, fond youth, each silly vain pretension.

sp.speaker: Oediddee
sp.l: What good awaits my tacit condescension?

sp.speaker: Otoo
sp.l: Your fortunes with my son I'll link for ever
So strong, that nought but death your fates can sever.
Surrounding isles shall own thy sovereign sway,
E'en distant WateooThe farthest situated from Otaheite. shall tribute pay,
Be you their Chief, their powerful AreekeeKing.
'T' Omai leave th' Otaheitean crown, this is Otoo's decree.
To Britain, now, Omai must repair,
And many dangers run to win the British fair.

sp.speaker: Oediddee
sp.l: Adieu, dear Omai, and gladly receive
That true and kind welcome that Britons can give.

sp.speaker: General Chorus
sp.l: Adieu, Prince Omai, and gladly receive
That true and kind welcome that Britons can give.

div.head: Scene 3.
div.stage: A view of Plymouth Sound, with Part of Mount Edgcumb, where Omai, with Harlequin as his servant, lands; as also does Don Struttolando, with Clown as his Servant: both in pursuit of the Object of their Affections, Londina. Different comic Business is here introduced, with the two following Airs by an old Water-cress Woman, or Fairy.

sp.speaker: Old Fairy
sp.l: Cold and hungry tho' I sing
Water-cresses o'the spring;
Your money, neighbours, little less is,
So buy my nice spring water-cresses;
Buy my nice spring water-cresses.

sp.speaker: Old Fairy
sp.l: Keep it, prithee keep it, my kind, my generous Boy;
And featly, nimbly use it, shou'd surly care annoy.
Quick posting on a sun0beam, here potent Towha sent me;
His charge "take care of Harlequin" and pow'rful spells he lent me.
Be still Omai's valet, he
With kind regard
Shall well reward
Thy care and strict fidelity.
Let pity touch thy bosom thro' frolick and vagary,
And though shalt ever find me thy true, thy guardian fairy.

div.stage: The Scene ends with Omai's losing his Talisman, and their going off to a Justice of Peace for its recovery.
